intro: Lantana veronicifolia, commonly known as the golden lantana, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its showy clusters of yellow to orange flowers. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a common sight in coastal areas and disturbed habitats. Lantana veronicifolia is also known for its fragrant foliage and is sometimes used in ornamental gardening.
